sentences.english: India's millionaire population grew 23% last year, the fastest in the world.
sentences.chinese: 去年印度的百萬富翁增加了23%，增幅居全球之冠。

sentences.english: Slightly increased the upper limit for the Magic Boost stat.
sentences.chinese: 略微提高魔法增幅力上限值。

sentences.english: Moreover, the amplitude effect of city environment on rainfall also is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 此外還初步分析了城市環境對強降水的增幅作用。

sentences.english: In addition, revenue does not necessarily increase security operation has also become a problem.
sentences.chinese: 另外，財政收入沒有一定的增幅，保運轉也成了問題。

sentences.english: Consumer banking operating profit rose 51% to $1.3bn.
sentences.chinese: 個人銀行業運作利潤增至13億美元，增幅51%。

sentences.english: The increase - 68 tons - exceeded any other countries' purchases. The next closest were Vietnam and Thailand, both with a rise of about 38 tons.
sentences.chinese: 緊隨中國之後的是越南和泰國，增幅大約爲38噸。

sentences.english: GM led all carmakers with a forty-seven percent increase.
sentences.chinese: 通用以47%的增幅在汽車製造商中獨佔鰲頭。

sentences.english: Total world production, and consumption is expected to show only minimal growth.
sentences.chinese: 預計世界異戊橡膠生產和消費增幅很小。

sentences.english: Higher current can be drawn from the output of an op- amp booster.
sentences.chinese: 運算放大增幅器能提供較大的電流輸出。

sentences.english: Sales of passenger cars rose by roughly 20% in the first quarter.
sentences.chinese: 公司第一季度的乘用車銷量增幅約爲20%。

sentences.english: If you paid the 3U kicker cost, you draw X cards.
sentences.chinese: 若你已支付其3藍的增幅費用，則你抽X張牌。

definition: degree of reduction (in prices, numbers etc)/decline/drop
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
